result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben B. Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ruben B. Vasquez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ruben B. Vasquez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not have contact with Elizabeth G, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Comply with Mental Health Treatment program.

Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Walker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP consecutive to 13CF1367; 1 year initial confinement w/credit for 271 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Walker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2, 3 & 4 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Atty Walker states the deft would like to use the 1997 PSI.  Court orders a new PSI.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/24/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Walker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  JSH continued to 8/13/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Walker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Walker states there may be a resolution but requests that trial date remain as scheduled.  JS remains set for 8/31/15 at 8:30am; JSH set for 6/11/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Walker and ADA Phan the time of the STC on 5/18/15 is changed from 8:30am to 1:15pm.
atty: L Walker

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Breitenbach's motion to withdraw is granted.  STC 5/18/15 at 8:30am, JS set for 8/31/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
to withdraw as counsel; filed by Atty J Breitenbach.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty J Breitenbach appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Case remains set for FPT on 4/27/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 3/20/15 at 1:30pm; FPT continued to 4/8/15 at 1:15pm and 4/27/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Jerold Breitenbach. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 2-17-15 @ 8:45am. Bond continued.
